@OctopusGilded My biggest recommendation is talking to a few people from the community you wish to add. Ask them what would a good character with that disability be, then also treat them like a normal character with dignity. Most people are more than just the disability. So that's important.

It's the biggest increase I've gotten since being disabled in 2003. But, on my end, calling it "massive" is a stretch. Increases have never kept up with true cost of living, neither will this. I'll barely break $1k/mo. Every year I lose more. There's no dignity on disability. https://t.co/7SDcPSJtRd

"100% of the human race will become disabled either permanently or temporary." I have been saying this since I can remember. Treat us with respect and dignity. Remember one day you will join us and we will welcome you. The disability community is strong and we have awsome allies.
